title: #refusetoclick - The Connection Between Human Trafficking & Porn

json.text: This is Anna.Wait wait don't click to someone else yet because
Anna's stuck here on your computer screen
and while you can walk away her image is stuck on the internet –
See your fantasy is Anna's nightmare.
There's a good chance recruiters lured her with flattery
perhaps they baited her with cash, maybe they even tranquilized her with date rape drugs
and if Anna is like many others, she stays sedated with alcohol,
weed (Marijuana) or coke (cocaine) to numb the pain.
Chances are, she face STD's (sexually transmitted diseases) and HIV because she's denied access to protection.
We don't know what she's been through because we only see Anna smiling
and they keep showing Anna smiling so that you’ll keep watching.
See, pornography is integral to human trafficking and prostitution.
in nine countries, almost half (49 percent) said that pornography was made of them while they were in prostitution.
This generation fights sex trafficking more than anyone ever has and more than anyone ever has, this generation consumes porn.
Fighting human trafficking and then watching porn is like protesting a corrupt politician
and then donating to his campaign.
you browse privately going from Anna to Zoe and then back to Anna
watch your favorite fantasy and then walk away -- but Anna is still there. She's stuck there
stuck in this life because you click.
Each click, each link, each URL visit and play button,
this is the currency of porn -- this is the price of Anna’s life
the 100 billion dollar pornography industry is fueling the appetite for children as well.
Teenage girls now make up the biggest slice viewable porn, which by definition
is considered trafficking.
The demand for porn fuels the trafficking industry
and you can take away that demand
you can cut the cord on this machine
you can bankrupt the system,
you can empty the pimp’s pockets,
you can free Anna by simply refusing to click.
